metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2394 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Wireshark 1.4.x before 1.4.13 and 1.6.x before 1.6.8 on the SPARC and Itanium platforms does not properly perform data alignment for a certain structure member, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a (1) ICMP or (2) ICMPv6 Echo Request packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2394` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.6.8-1
libwireshark11 - 1.6.8-1
libwiretap8 - 1.6.8-1
libwscodecs2 - 1.6.8-1
libwsutil9 - 1.6.8-1
tshark - 1.6.8-1
wireshark - 1.6.8-1
wireshark-common - 1.6.8-1
wireshark-gtk - 1.6.8-1
wireshark-qt - 1.6.8-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> per Debian, not suitable for code injection

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.8-1').
